授業目的: This course serves as an introduction to the study of management. It is designed to help the students understand the basic principles, functions, and role of management in organizations and society. The course covers both contemporary issues in management and discussion on traditional functions of management including planning, organizing, leading, and controlling. This course will help students to develop skills, competencies, techniques, and knowledge needed to successfully manage an organization in today’s competitive environment.
到達目標:
Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to:

a) Identify the principles of managing an organization.
b) Outline the historical evolution of management theories.
c) Explain the key functions of management including planning, organizing, leading, and controlling.
d) Evaluate the various challenges faced by today’s managers.
e) Apply the theoretical knowledge in solving managerial and organizational problems.
f) Enhance their presentation and communication skills.
g) Increase their abilities to participate in interactive class environment and work in small teams.
授業方法:
This course will be offered in an on-demand format through Monday, October 11.
When the number of registered students is finalized and the classroom environment standards are met, the class will be held face-to-face. If the standards are not met, the course will continue to be offered in an on-demand format for health and safety reasons.

In case of face-to-face class format, classes will be conducted in the designated classroom unless otherwise instructed. The online class participants will receive online simultaneous interactive delivery during class time.

In case of on-demand class format, classes will be conducted as type-A on demand online classes (with timetable). Also, links for class recordings will be provided on LUNA after the class. Every week, class materials will be uploaded to the homepage of the course on LUNA.
In addition, please check the “Study required Outside Class” section for details on delivery schedule.
